item.title: 罗杰-费德勒支持的安踏上调年度销售预期，促销和新品发布刺激需求
item.description: 罗杰-费德勒（Roger Federer）支持的On Holding公司周二上调了年度销售预期，并表示将不得不采取选择性定价，以减轻美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税影响。【原文：Roger Federer-backed On Holding raised its annual sales forecast on Tuesday and said it would have to undertake selective pricing to mitigate impacts from U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs.】

item.title: 关税不确定性挥之不去，中国对美出口商步履谨慎
item.description: 邓金玲是一家向美国出口保温瓶的中国公司的经理，当她听到华盛顿削减对中国的惩罚性关税至少90天的消息时，她和丈夫打开了一瓶香槟。【原文：When she heard the news that Washington had slashed punitive tariffs on China for at least 90 days, Deng Jinling, manager of a Chinese company that exports thermos flasks to the U.S., popped open a bottle of champagne with her husband.】

item.title: 中国的 JD.com 季度收入超过预期
item.description: 周二，中国电子商务巨头京东商城（JD.com）的季度营收超过了市场预期，这表明，即使美国加征关税和经济长期疲软影响了消费者情绪，该公司仍有稳定的需求。【原文：China's JD.com topped market estimates for quarterly revenue on Tuesday, in a sign the e-commerce giant saw steady demand even as U.S. tariffs and prolonged economic weakness weighed on consumer sentiment.】

item.title: 订阅用户增加，腾讯音乐季度收入大增
item.description: 受在线音乐服务用户增长的推动，腾讯音乐娱乐周二公布的第一季度营收超出分析师预期。【原文：Tencent Music Entertainment exceeded analysts' expectations for first-quarter revenue on Tuesday, driven by growth in subscribers for its online music services.】

item.title: 贝莱德的芬克认为数万亿美元闲置，波动性持续存在
item.description: 贝莱德首席执行官拉里-芬克（Larry Fink）表示，在贸易战忧虑和美国经济不确定性的背景下，数万亿美元的金融火力被闲置在现金中，美国的赤字开始令投资者感到恐慌。【原文：BlackRock CEO Larry Fink says tens of trillions of dollars of financial firepower is sitting idle in cash amid trade war worries and uncertainty over the United States economy, whose deficits are beginning to spook investors.】

item.title: 外国投资者 5 月重返亚洲股市，扭转了长期资金外流的局面
item.description: 由于对贸易谈判取得进展的乐观情绪缓解了对美国加征关税加剧全球经济放缓的担忧，5 月份迄今为止亚洲股市正在吸引外资，与今年前四个月的外资流出情况相比出现了急剧逆转。【原文：Asian equities are attracting foreign investments so far in May, marking a sharp reversal from outflows in the first four months of the year, as optimism over progress in trade talks has eased fears of U.S. tariffs fuelling a global economic slowdown.】

item.title: 报告称，2025 年美国的国外旅游支出将下降 7
item.description: 据世界旅行和旅游理事会（World Travel and Tourism Council）称，由于政治和强势美元促使外国游客选择其他目的地，预计 2025 年美国的国际旅游支出将下降约 7%，即 125 亿美元。【原文：International travel spending in the United States is expected to decline about 7%, or $12.5 billion, in 2025 as politics and a strong dollar prompt foreign visitors to opt for other destinations, according to the World Travel and Tourism Council.】

item.title: 日产汽车宣布新的成本节约措施，暂不公布 2025 财年业绩预期
item.description: 日本汽车制造商日产汽车公司周二宣布了一系列新的成本节约措施，包括再裁员1.1万人，并暂缓发布本年度至2026年3月的财务盈利预期。【原文：Japanese automaker Nissan announced on Tuesday a slate of new cost-saving measures including 11,000 more job cuts and held off on releasing financial earnings estimates for the current year through March 2026.】

item.title: 特朗普关税闪电战达成交易，但未能解决全球贸易问题
item.description: 贸易专家和分析人士说，唐纳德-特朗普的关税闪电战正在达成一些初步协议，包括美国和中国的天价关税暂停90天，以及与英国达成一项有限的贸易协定，但这位美国总统远未重新平衡全球贸易流动。【原文：Donald Trump's tariff blitz is yielding some initial deals, including a 90-day pause in sky-high U.S. and Chinese duties and a limited trade pact with Britain, but the U.S. president is far from rebalancing global commerce flows, trade experts and analysts said.】

item.title: 英国 M&S 称客户信息在网络攻击中被窃取
item.description: 英国零售商玛莎百货公司周二表示，一些客户的个人信息在网络攻击中被窃取，这次攻击使其在线业务瘫痪了三个多星期。【原文：British retailer Marks and Spencer said on Tuesday some personal customer information was taken in the cyber attack that has crippled its online operation for more than three weeks.】

item.title: 美国银行称，基金经理自 2006 年以来最看淡美元
item.description: 美国银行周二发布的全球基金经理调查（FMS）显示，由于唐纳德-特朗普总统混乱的贸易政策降低了投资者对美国资产的偏好，5月份全球资产经理持有19年来最大的美元减持仓位。【原文：Global asset managers held their biggest underweight position in the dollar in 19 years in May, as President Donald Trump's chaotic trade policy cut investor appetite for U.S. assets, Bank of America's global fund manager survey (FMS) showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 亚太贸易特使讨论关税时代的多边合作
item.description: 亚太地区的贸易特使们本周将齐聚韩国，就多边合作展开讨论，而会谈正值各国争相应对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的全面关税之际。【原文：Asia-Pacific trade envoys will gather this week in South Korea for discussions on multilateral cooperation, with talks taking place at a time when countries are scrambling to respond to U.S. President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs.】

item.title: 全球首家商业规模的电子甲醇工厂在丹麦开业
item.description: 本周二，全球首家商业规模的电子甲醇工厂在丹麦投入运营，航运巨头马士基公司将购买部分产品，作为其集装箱船队的低排放燃料。【原文：The world's first commercial-scale e-methanol plant began operations in Denmark on Tuesday, with shipping giant Maersk set to buy part of the production as a low-emission fuel for its fleet of container ships.】

item.title: 美国暂停对中国征收关税给 "中国加一 "国家带来压力
item.description: 中美达成新协议，暂停互相征收天价关税，这迫使越南和墨西哥等制造业中心与美国达成更好的协议，以继续从全球生产商的 "中国加一 "战略中获益。【原文：A new U.S.-China agreement to pause sky-high tariffs on each other is pressuring manufacturing hubs such as Vietnam and Mexico to make their own, better deals with the U.S. to continue benefiting from a "China-plus-one" strategy by global producers.】

item.title: 受美国关税影响，本田全年利润下降 59%，推迟加拿大电动车计划
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）征收关税带来的不确定性，日本本田汽车公司预测本财年利润将下降59%，并表示将搁置在加拿大建立电动汽车供应链的计划。【原文：Japan's Honda Motor forecast a 59% profit decrease in the current financial year and said it would put on hold a plan to build an EV supply chain in Canada, amid the uncertainty stemming from U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs.】

item.title: 日本软银集团第四季度盈利 35 亿美元，超出预期
item.description: 日本投资集团软银集团（SoftBank Group）1-3 月净利润达 5,170 亿日元（约合 34.9 亿美元），原因是其持有的电信资产表现良好。【原文：Japanese investment conglomerate SoftBank Group booked a net profit of 517 billion yen ($3.49 billion) for January-March as its telecommunications holdings performed well.】

item.title: 因看好贸易休战，高盛将美国经济衰退概率从 45% 下调至 35
item.description: 高盛将美国经济衰退预期从 45% 下调至 35%，成为首家下调预期的大型券商，此前与中国达成的临时关税休战协议提振了全球贸易战有所缓和的希望。【原文：Goldman Sachs cut its recession forecast for the U.S. to 35% from 45%, the first major brokerage to do so, after a temporary tariff truce with China boosted hopes of some easing in the global trade war.】

item.title: 苹果供应商 IQE 的年收入在市场预期之内
item.description: 英国半导体公司 IQE 周二表示，预计其 2025 财年的收入将与市场预期一致，并补充说该公司正在关注出售其台湾业务的可能性。【原文：British semiconductor company IQE expects its revenue for the fiscal year 2025 to align with market expectations, the company said on Tuesday, adding that it was focusing on the potential sale of its Taiwan operations.】

item.title: 日经新闻》称，作为重组的一部分，日产将暂停部分国内工厂的运营
item.description: 据《日经商业日报》周二报道，作为业务重组努力的一部分，日本日产汽车公司决定暂停部分国内工厂的运营。【原文：Japan's Nissan Motor has decided to suspend operations at some domestic factories as part of a business restructuring effort, the Nikkei business daily reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 2025 年，CATL 将在全球最大规模的上市活动中为银行提供低廉的费用
item.description: 处理今年迄今为止全球最大上市交易的投资银行将获得远低于行业标准的承销费，在上市交易长期低迷之后，顾问们愿意忍受微薄的利润来赢得业务。【原文：Investment banks handling the world's largest listing so far this year are set to earn underwriting fees well below the industry norm, with advisers willing to endure skinny margins to win business following a prolonged slump in listings.】

item.title: 彭博新闻社报道：美国贸易休战后，中国取消了对波音公司的交货禁令
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周二报道，在与美国达成贸易休战协议后，中国取消了对航空公司接收波音飞机的禁令。【原文：China has removed a ban on airlines taking delivery of Boeing planes following a trade truce with the United States, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 独家报道：在美国关税谈判之际，越南加大打击进口假冒产品的力度
item.description: 路透社查阅的文件显示，在美国指责越南是假冒伪劣和数字盗版的主要集散地并威胁要征收严厉的关税之后，越南正在加大打击假冒伪劣和数字盗版的力度。【原文：Vietnam is stepping up its fight against counterfeits and digital piracy after the United States accused the country of being a major hub for these illegal activities and threatened crippling tariffs, documents reviewed by Reuters show.】

item.title: 美国将对中国货物征收的 "最低 "关税从 120% 下调至 54
item.description: 白宫的一项行政命令称，美国将从 5 月 14 日起把对中国货物征收的 "最低 "关税从 120% 下调至 54%，并继续征收最低 100 美元的统一关税。【原文：A White House executive order said that the U.S. would cut the "de minimis" tariff on China shipments to 54% from 120%, with a minimum flat fee of $100 to remain starting from May 14.】

item.title: 财富管理平台 Addepar 在新一轮融资中估值 32.5 亿美元
item.description: 财富管理平台提供商 Addepar 在新一轮 2.3 亿美元的融资中创下了 32.5 亿美元的估值，这得益于金融顾问们争相在动荡的市场中为富裕客户提供更好的数据。【原文：Wealth management platform provider Addepar has hit a valuation of $3.25 billion in a fresh $230 million funding round, as it benefits from a race by financial advisors to arm wealthy clients with better data in volatile markets.】

item.title: 欧洲央行在战略审查中坚持过去的刺激政策
item.description: 欧洲央行的几位决策者告诉路透社记者，欧洲央行将在一次战略审查中坚持其过去十年的激进刺激政策，回避在一轮高通胀和巨额亏损之后进行自我批评的呼声。【原文：The European Central Bank will stand by its aggressive stimulus policy of the last decade in a strategy review, side-stepping calls for self-criticism after a bout of high inflation and sizeable losses, several ECB policymakers told Reuters.】

item.title: 欧洲 贸易战暂歇，重回磨合期
item.description: 洛基-斯威夫特对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Rocky Swift】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》报道：停电后，西班牙调查小型发电厂的网络漏洞
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周二报道，西班牙正在要求小型发电企业提供有关其网络防御的信息，因为调查上个月大停电事件的调查人员试图确定它们是否是被坏人利用来瘫痪该国电网的薄弱环节。【原文：Spain is demanding information from small electricity generators on their cyber defences as investigators probing last month’s blackout seek to determine whether they were a weak link exploited by bad actors to bring down the country’s power grid, the Financial Times reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 澳大利亚养老基金开始质疑美国战略
item.description: 由于对美国经济增长的信心减弱，澳大利亚 4.2 万亿澳元（约合 2.7 万亿美元）养老金领域的基金正在重新考虑其长期坚持的购买美国资产和美元的一些策略。【原文：Funds in Australia's A$4.2 trillion ($2.7 trillion) pension sector are rethinking some of their long-held strategies of buying U.S. assets and the dollar, as confidence in American growth wanes.】

item.title: 印度向世贸组织提交的通知显示，印度拟对美国征收反关税
item.description: 印度向世界贸易组织（WTO）表示，印度拟对美国生产并运往印度的部分产品征收关税，以对抗华盛顿对亚洲第三大经济体生产的钢铁和铝产品征收的关税。【原文：India has told the World Trade Organisation (WTO) that it proposes to levy duties on some products made in the U.S. and shipped to India, to counter Washington's tariffs on steel and aluminium products produced in Asia's No.3 economy.】

item.title: 洞察力：中国的人工智能仿人机器人旨在改变制造业
item.description: 在上海郊区一个庞大的仓库里，数十个仿人机器人在操作员的操纵下，一遍又一遍地执行着折叠 T 恤、制作三明治和开门等任务。【原文：In a sprawling warehouse in a Shanghai suburb, dozens of humanoid robots are manoeuvred by their operators to carry out tasks like folding a T-shirt, making a sandwich and opening doors, over and over again.】
